revised_title: Zero Frequency Modes and Instability in Maclaurin Spheroids
tldr: The authors analyze the zero frequency modes of Maclaurin spheroids, which are uniformly rotating, uniform density solutions to the equations governing a self-gravitating perfect fluid in Newtonian mechanics. They find that these modes are important for understanding instability in astronomical systems and provide a table of eccentricity and angular velocity values at which zero frequency modes occur along the Maclaurin sequence.
